parser

Interface Rule

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ILRule, OLRule

    public interface Rule
    Represent a rewrite rule. A rule contains a preExpr which contains a single of Symbol that is going to be replaced, and a postExpr that contains the substitute symbols: preExpr -> postExpr.

    Each rule has a probability to happen if it is in conflict with another (for non determinist grammars)

    Author:
    xinouch

      • applyOnce

        int applyOnce(int indexPrev,
            ListSymbols phraseFromPreviousIteration,
            int indexNew,
            ListSymbols toBeModified)
        Try to apply this rule on the given index of toBeModified. phraseFromPreviousIteration is used for non context-free grammars. For the first calls, use call the function like this: applyOnce(index, toBeModified.clone(), toBeModified);

        The returned value may be:

        • 0 if nothing has been changed
        • -1 if there has been one deletion
        • 1 if a character has been changed
        • x if x characters have been inserted
        Parameters:
        indexPrev - index from the previous
        phraseFromPreviousIteration - the phrase as it was on last iteration
        indexNew - the actual index in the new list actually in calcul
        toBeModified - the phrase to work on
        Returns:
        the offset of the next symbol not changed.

      • getProba

        double getProba()
        Returns:
        the probability for this rule to happen. It is 1 for determinist grammars.
